titleStmt.title: Fourtie articles in the High Court of Parliament, against William Lang, who was vicar in the parish of Bradworthy, in the county of Devon, but now prisoner in the city of London. With a petition to the Right Honorable House of Commons, shewing the odiousnesse of his life and actions, desiring that his triall may not be prolonged, nor his execution hindred, being one of the late tribe of lordly bishops.

Fourtie articles in the High Court of Parliament, against William Lang, who was vicar in the parish of Bradworthy, in the county of Devon, but now prisoner in the city of London. With a petition to the Right Honorable House of Commons, shewing the odiousnesse of his life and actions, desiring that his triall may not be prolonged, nor his execution hindred, being one of the late tribe of lordly bishops.
titleStmt.author: Judd, Robert, fl. 1642.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Tho. Bates in the Old Bayley,

notesStmt.note: The petition (title page verso) was submitted by Robert Judd and the other parishioners in Bradworthy, Devon.
The publication year is given according to Lady Day dating.
A variant (Wing F1621) has imprint undated.
Reproduction of the original in the Harvard University Library.
